message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM

Reasoning: The paper primarily focuses on computer vision techniques for anomaly detection in public places, specifically on roads. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also discusses the challenges and future possibilities in this field, which could fall under the sub-categories of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper emphasizes learning methods applied on video scenes, which could fall under the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). Finally, the paper discusses the types of anomalies and features used, which could fall under the sub-category of cs.MM (Multimedia).
